review:
not that i thought housefull 4 to be a serious film on india-china relationship, but never expected it to be this absurd either. well, as housefull franchise’s brand ambassador aakhri pasta (chunkey pandey) says, ‘i am joking.’ this is exactly what the trailer promised it to be.

right in the beginning, while punching a co-actor, max (bobby deol) thunders, “aaj mera fast hai isiliye thoda slow maara (i punched you slow because i am fasting today),” and the audience immediately recognises the setting. it’s the same one in which covert lovers make out in front of the girl’s sleepwalking father, or the one where a python grabs someone’s balls. the point is that housefull films were never meant to be intelligent. these are literally slap and stick comedies, if you dare say.

the story is about three london-based brothers—harry (akshay kumar), max (bobby deol) and roy (riteish deshmukh). they want to marry three daughters—kriti (kriti sanon), neha (kirti kharbanda) and pooja (pooja hegde)—of a rich businessman, played by ranjit, who keeps switching to ‘beti’ from ‘beauty.’ i wonder why they didn’t use kriti kharbanda’s real name!

harry, who gets flashes from his past life 600 years ago, believes his brothers and everyone around them, were part of a bizarre story that took place in 1419. the credit must be given to kumar who is wholeheartedly into this ridiculous set-up, and wants us to believe him. some of us did as i heard whistles around. however, it wasn’t actually wonderful to see deol reminiscing in the tune of ‘soldier, soldier,’ and deshmukh playing an effeminate character. you know how they introduce him: isne gender ka tender nahi bhara. i don’t know how to translate that accurately.


let me break it down for you: it’s one of those films where the actor would ask the actress, “bees ke baad kya aata hai (what comes after 20),” before kissing her.

or, somebody would come and tell the camera, “london me do hi cheez famous hain, big ben and big bhai, (there are only two things famous in london, big ben and big brother).”

big ben and big bhai! ben-bhai! you get the drift!


somebody says ‘don’t be horsing around’ and the next shot is of horses. if you still don’t find it intriguing enough then the director farhad samji will present you the royal family of britain, dancing to thoughtfully penned song ‘chumma.’

as if this was not enough. a character faking pregnancy says, “main abla hoon tabla nahin,” and somebody immediately retorts, “ye katappa toh ek hi cut me pappa ban gaya.”

probably this much criticism is not justified. when did the makers pretend otherwise? but the well of jokes dries after a while and the same gags keep repeating. had there not been akhay kumar, it would have become a really painful watch. he has barely managed to stop housefull 4 from becoming another tees maar khan.


it’s funny in parts but can’t hold attention for fifteen minutes straight at any juncture. there lies the problem. kumar’s excellent comic timing isn’t enough to cover up other characters’ lack of substance.

despite all this, two brilliantly placed things in script cracked me up. the first is three pigeons named neil, nitin and mukesh, and the second is this dialogue: “agar main badshah hoon toh tu kya honey singh hai (if i am badshah then who are you? honey singh?).”

oh, i laughed so hard.

no, i am joking.

rating: 1.5/5

amazing movie #mast hai. must watch for every one(go and watch).
 this movie is a perfect mixture of *comedy+entertainment+epic+romance+emotion*. it is not an epic action movie but it is a paisa vasool comedy and you will get impressed by its unexpected plot twists and a really amazing immersive story!
a complete comedy entertainment, full of laughs, dashing dialogue timing and surprise sequences makes this movie highly outstanding. a great story presentation along with amazing historical scenes visualization.

fantastic comedy twists displayed on many occasions with stunning acting from all the cast. akshay kumar define himself to next level, and bobby deol is always a splendid actor, he must act more in future movies, ritesh has performed equally important. all 3 heroines are pretty beautiful and acted very nicely, these 3 heroines must be given more movies in similar big budget because they are solid performers of present time.

it’s a full on entertainer for diwali. it will make you laugh and keep you entertained from start till the credits start to roll.
don’t trust the verdict of firangi mindset critics or moviegoers. they will accept and enjoy racheal having multiple love affairs in american tv show friends but when an actor like akshay kumar makes them laugh that literally looks funny then they blindly call it “aaaathooo”. 
to those criticising the film i would ask “if you didn’t like housefull 4 only for the lack of logic then why did you like avengers infinity war where a normal human tony stark goes and easily fights on some distant planet with a alien who coincidentally also speaks english”. it’s a typical mindset of these double standard people that if something is said in english or if something is done as the americans and the europeans do then it is classy, outstanding and mind blowing but if the same thing is said in hindi or done as we indians then it’s cheap, third class and pathetic. 
as indians it’s important for us to support our films regardless of whether it’s from which part of india otherwise the day is not far when we would have nothing but only hollywood films to watch in theatres and on tv. i am not saying that americans films should be removed from our theatres but it’s also important that our indian films don’t lose their market just because of this typical firangi mindset of some indians who by mistake were left in india after 1947.
lastly not every mainstream actor has the guts to do comedy so perfectly as akshay kumar has done for the past 19-20 years. most of the mainstream actors are either doing biopics or doing some other serious stuff but there are hardly few actors who are good at comedy and want this genre to thrive. it’s akshay kumar whose films like phir hera pheri, heyy babyy, bhool bhulaiyaa, welcome are still made into memes and not the films of srk, salman or aamir.

#housefull4  - comedy of errors and terrors 🤪

foremost was the comedy on our part - we booked a show for sunday 10:50. reached the mall only to realise the movie was for 10:50 pm not am 🙈🤣🤣
monday being a working day and my daughter’s science test, we knew the tickets would go waste. 

but being the movie buff i am, i tried and succeeded in getting a friend to come along with me so that only 1 ticket went waste. 

now on to the movie - as expected and as promised given the housefull franchise, it’s fourth chapter is totally senseless, cheesy, slapstick and beyond any logic. 

however, we laughed our hearts out at the creatively nonsensical dialogues, drama, characterisation and songs. sometimes in disgust and at times purely at the guts of the makers and actors of the movie... बहुत जिगरा चाहिऐ to get stellar performers like nawazuddin siddiqui and rana daggubati to do what they did 😂😂😂

the locations, sets, costumes and jewellery are exceptional!  sajid nadiadwala truly has faith in this franchise for making such a big budget film 😆

if you are questioning my choice of cinema, then i would like to clarify that my daughter is a huge akshay kumar, housefull and golmaal series fan. so we had booked the movie for her viewing pleasure 🤪

as for my friend and i, it was a well deserved break from the monotony and seriousness of life. there were many people like us at the theatre and some even crazier than us who couldn’t control their laughter in the lift on the way out. 

so we all ended up laughing out loud at 2 am as we entered back into the real world 🤩

p.s.: my family and friends who wait for my reviews before watching a movie - this one’s not for you 🤪 but if you really need a break, go watch it with friends or in a group and enjoy the silliness!!

movies from the houseful franchise are expected to be hilarious, colourful, multi-star and with out much logic.

houseful 4 fulfills all the above and it is definitely full of entertainment. all the locations are fantastic, akshay kumar does a wonderful job in both roles with his superb acting & wonderful comic timing. ritesh deshmukh & bobby deol have done justice to their characters. all the actresses are a visual treat. even chunkey pandey, johnny lever, ranjeet and other supporting actors are amazing.

overall it is a very well made movie with core focus on comedy which it successfully does. the entire concept of reincarnation has been wonderfully crafted on screen with bits of comedy. comic timing and the dialogue delivery of all actors makes the audience burst in laughter every few moments.

this is a movie that can be seen with friends, family, romantic partner and anybody you are comfortable laughing out loud with....

amazing movie #mast hai. must watch for every one(go and watch).
 this movie is a perfect mixture of *comedy+entertainment+epic+romance+emotion*. it is not an epic action movie but it is a paisa vasool comedy and you will get impressed by its unexpected plot twists and a really amazing immersive story!

akshay,bobby, ritesh, nawazuddin, ranadaggubali, johhnylever, chunkey sir and pooja, kriti maam and others have used their best to bring out the true fun in the epic *reincarnation* flashback based story...with hilarious scenes and songs.(only a few unwanted words were used for fun, a bit disappointing here)

music and background musics were really thrilling. though the places were sometimes animated, sajid nadiadwala 
and crew did their best to bring the movie come alive with its own glory 
thanks #housefull4 team. keep it up. wishing for more such time-pass comedy epics!
9/10*stars by me!

houseful 4. rating 4.9/5

a complete comedy entertainment, full of laughs, dashing dialogue timing and surprise sequences makes this movie highly outstanding. a great story presentation along with amazing historical scenes visualization.

fantastic comedy twists displayed on many occassions with stunning acting from all the cast. akshay kumar define himeself to next level, and bobby deol is always a splendid actor, he must act more in future movies, reitesh has performed equally important. all 3 heroines are pretty beautiful and acted very nicely, these 3 heroines must be given more movies in similar big budget because they are solid performers of present time.

firts part is splendid and second part is again more splendid. 

must watch in theater.

in 1419, the love stories of three couples are left unfinished owing to a conspiracy. in 2019, reincarnated, they meet again and the romances are rekindled. but this time pairings are mixed up. can what was done in 1419 be undone in 2019?

in its fourth edition the housefull franchise ensures that it takes its brand of over the top and mindless humour forward. actually, it's more like the reverse, since it rewinds back six hundred years to the 15th century.

but first, it's london of 2019, where harry (akshay kumar) is a hairdresser who alternately has bouts of memory loss and flashes from his past life. max (bobby deol) and roy (riteish deshmukh) are his brothers. together they hatch a plan to marry kriti, neha and pooja (kriti sanon, kriti kharbanda and pooja hegde respectively), the three daughters of a billionaire, thakral (ranjeet), to be able to pay off the loot money of a mafia don michael that they have misplaced. when the marriage destination is inadvertently fixed as sitamgarh in india, the couples head there and harry meets his past life friend aakhri pasta (chunky pandey) and recalls everything from that time. the three pairs of lovers - rajkumar bala dev singh (akshay kumar) and princess madhu (kriti sanon), bangdu maharaj (riteish deshmukh) and princess mala (pooja hegde), angrakshak dharamputra (bobby deol, yes the pun is not lost here) and princess meena (kriti kharbanda) are killed, leaving their love stories unfinished when they get caught up in an evil design to eliminate them. although, bala himself is 'shaitaan ka sala' and has laid a trap to marry mala, so that he can become the king of sitamgarh.

the main hitch now is that, in 2019 the couples are mixed up, and bala (akshay kumar) decides that the pairings must be set right so none of them end up with their sister or brother-in-law from their past life.

so with this central plot point in hand, housefull4 takes off. of course, this mission to set things 'right' leads to confusions galore and a deluge of characters, who spring in and out of the narrative and from their last life to present life. there is a sprinkling of mindless comic moments owing to the general silliness all around. and a dollop of low- brow, crass humor. a special low point is when princess meena pretends to be molested to convince dharamputra to marry her. add to that, there are portions that drag and jokes that feel dated.

the film's increasingly loud background score (especially in the second half) and the cgi in the period setting leave a lot to be desired. and a running joke on three pigeons named neil, nitin and mukesh that doesn't actually fly.

of the actresses, it is kriti sanon who has the most lengthy role and she pulls it off well. kriti kharbanda and pooja hegde are reduced to being props, owing to their limited screen time. interestingly, all three are uniformly dressed in the same colors, as if it were a deliberate attempt to not be able to tell them apart. riteish deshmukh gets the quirks of his characters well and does manage to pull in some laughs. manoj pahwa, nawazuddin siddiqui, rana daggubatti and johnny lever have their oddball parts to play in the film - though some seem just pointless. and yes, archana puran singh pops up often in a photo.

but largely, it is akshay kumar who has the most fleshed out role and shoulders most of the film. and he definitely shines in most of them getting the comic timing right.

needless to add, don't go looking for logic in housefull4 (but still, how did the blood on rana daggubatti's blue jacket magically disappear in the last scene?). in the last 30 minutes, kriti repeatedly asks, "yeh sab kya ho raha hain?" a sentiment that could be echoed by the viewers.

overall, housefull4 ends up as a complete mad caper. which, if you're a fan of the housefull brand of comedy, might appeal to you. but if you are not, then proceed with caution.

the final verdict: not so full of comedy.

absolutely disappointed and disgruntled with housefull 4. don't know from where to start ,its almost like i wasted my money and need a refund.what was going through akshay's mind when he signed this movie.huge star cast ,big sets and locations,budget doesn't compensate for weak story and screenplay.worst of all they made a spoof of one of the greatest indian movies-bahubali the conclusion when akshay kumar aka rajkumar bala gets exiled from his kingdom and they tried to make the comic version of the jaykara song .very cheap and pathetic. atleast don't insult the film if you can't respect it and have capibility of making an epic like the one ss rajamouli made.comedy is repetetive and jokes are blown out of proportion.housefull veterans akshay and riteish deshmukh fail to save this film as they try hard to make you laugh but fail nonetheless.bala track is overly long and repetitive and bangru maharaj 's character which riteish plays is overstretched and exaggeration of similar dialogues.bobby(body) deol acts a stuntman in the entire movie only present to flex his muscles and he is at the recieving of butt of jokes based on his previous movies like soldier.the girls kriti sanon, pooja hedge and kriti kharbanda waste their talent thoroughly and are only there to add the glamour quotient and spice up the songs.the much needed relief comes from scenes featuring veterans ranjit and ace comedian johnny lever .rana daggubati who played the wicked baddie bhallaldeva is an embarrassment only to fight and shout for the all the scenes featuring him.another talent gone waste.it seems these days that every movie franchises like golmaal ,dhamaal and housefull are going on a landslide and unless they come up with some content ,producers and directors shouldn't make garbage movies just for increasing their already huge bank balance.get nostalgic remembering the golden days of comedy movies like bhool bhulaiya,bhagam bhag, golmaal 1,dhammal 1,hera pheri,chup chup ke, welcome and the list goes on .it is almost like we won't get to get classics like these again as they are hiring overrated actors like kartik aryan in the bhool bhulaiya sequel.akshay should have done it.he only can pull off something like that. it will be a flop.it is like a bygone era.yes you don't need to put any logic and sense in movies like these but this is way beyond another level of stupidity and irrelevant comedy.my ratings 2/5 .i recommend you should instead watch old movies at  television instead of watching this one unless you really love the housefull series

the laughter club just came to your nearest theater, akshay, riteish and bobby are at it again. as if the previous three installments of housefull weren't enough to make us laugh till we pop, nadiadwala grandson entertainment has brought us another one this diwali, rest assured this will film will make you laugh until you roll on the floor.

the boys are paired opposite three powerful actresses kriti sanon (princess madhu), pooja hegde (princess mala), kriti kharbanda (princess meena), two of whom will be playing in a comic film for the first time. the supporting cast includes versatile actors such as shakti kapoor, archana puran singh, chunky pandey, nawazuddin siddiqui, manoj pahwa, johnny lever, jamie lever and the evergreen rajneet aka 'aye'.

rana dagubatti of baahubali fame and sharad kelkar play the cruel antagonists.

amazing performances by all the actors, superb team work and quality assurance done by nadiadwala grandson team, fantabulous work done by the vfx and sound engineers make this movie stand out. there is not a single moment in the film that you will want to miss.

the story set in medieval india, revolves around three love stories which were buried in sands of time due to the cruel suryabhan who wants to eliminate ranjeet aka 'aye' and wants to become king, but he must not let princess madhu (kriti sanon) get married to bala (akshay kumar). he ultimately succeeds in his plan and takes over the kingdom of sitamgarh.

but destiny has its own ways and the couples are reborn after almost 6 centuries. will they find their true loves again? will they reunite? we are not going to spoil the fun.

go watch the movie in a theater near you. don't forget to get the popcorn and colas!

houseful 4
beyond mindless,limitleslly silly, big ticket disaster 1.5 star ⭐.5
except for climax and a few countable laughs the rest of the film is full of creepy dialouges like aaj mera fast hai isiliye slow maara , mai abla hu tabla nahi , bhardo meri maang nahi toh cheer dungi teri taang and a lot more,and the actors praying to 3 pigeons hum pur hagoo and they are apparently named neil nitin mukesh. the film is too loud and hardly funny, the first half is dosent even seem like a comedy film only the last 15 minutes has some laugh out moments because of akshay kumar. overall its a big ticket disappointment, even if you go with zero expectations the zero wont be fulfilled.

things to look out for 
>at very few points humour is on point those are a few fun moments specially the last few minutes of climax 
>akshay kumar is the only saving grace in the film who has got the comic time right 
>bala bala song is a delight 

negatives 
>creepiest and horrible dialouges written all over the film making it even more horrible film
>the first half is not at any point funny ,looked more like a cheap budget period film 
> thin line story and poor direction 
>screenplay seems repetetive and boring 
>overacting and loud acting by the complete cast making it unbearable at points 
>bobby deol and ritesh deshmukh hardly had any notable scenes it was all about bala 
>nawazudin siddques cameo was the worst cameo ever in the recent times in a film 
>the direction is too bad and seemed very silly at almost every point in the film 
>too many unnecessary songs and senseless kawali added up also songs being edited from bahubali 

final verdict

disappointing diwali release , a film thats not worth watching in the cinemas , its a out and out disappointment . no fun no humour in the house . a movie to skip

this was an exceptionally funny movie. it was just what the trailer promised : hilarious and humorous. the slight strokes of the previous housefull films like "mammamiya" and "aehhhh", made tge film even more interesting to watch. but this particular film is slightly different from the other housefull films as the story is a bit unique and mysterious at the same time with all the "reincarnation drama".
harry (akshay kumar) has the best character and screen presence in the movie. bala's entry will leave the house uproarious. and the way he forgets something when he hears something loud and his eyes become all big and cute; i just loved it. and it was kind of funny that someone with a short term memory is the one who has flashbacks of what happened 600 years ago. it just makes you love the script writer. roy's (ritesh deshmukh) character will also make you want double up. max (bobby deol) is the bahubali of the film and his name dharam putra 600 years ago will make you wonder about something 😉. the girls were also marvellous and i loved their roles in the film. the background tune of the film is also really really good. sometimes the movie will give you bahubali types feeling with r

housefull4 _ it's the family entertainer you should definitely watch once. the plot unfold as the, epic reincarnation drama. harrry(akshaykumar) works within london with his brother n friend. (bobby and ritesh). he sees visuals of his past life often. he has the habbit of forgetting things. all three boys pretend to love three girls of the wealthy businessman as they want to pay the loans of michael :one don. they plan for destination wedding within sitamgarhh. when they reach there, the hotel's workerboy aakhiri pasta recognises him as prince frm their past lives. he also recognises ritesh as dancer and bobby as the bodyguard of the three princesses which are the same 3 girls these boys are about to marry. the twists cme as akshaykumar when reminded by pasta about his pastlife character as baala the prince of madhavgarh, tries to convince the girls and the other two boys about it and tries to sort out the confusion between interchanging of the grooms and bridegrooms of this life, he gets beaten up and being called mad. he also warns them of gamaa who's after their life the pastlife and maybe dis too. the boys gradually remember everything about who they were and who were their love interests. they try to fix things within their lives. when the girls' brother pappu who's gamaa reborn comes to know his pastlife, he lashes out and comes fuming to beat these people. that time the girls too recall everything and they together try to face gamaa. the mysteries of their pastlife unfolds as, they discover who was the real culprit to anger gamaa and kill his brother. they manage to defeat him and then all get married to their respective loveinterests. the whole film's full of comic one-liners and akshaykumar's entry and dialogues makes it lively. the way the character balaa's potrayed, it's hilarious and ritesh deshmukh's  dance leaves you laughing. the besst moment for us was when gamma alias pappu was singing qawwali  of badla badla badla. it makes one laugh to his besst. though the movie has no fix storylinee, it doesn't boree any one and keeps you lively to watch it. the music album, it's , gud too specially bhutraaja and ek chumma, i loved it. giving the movie 3 out of 5.

well well..i've watched all the films from the housefull franchise and i'd say that this one (housefull 4) is way better than the first and second and definitely less interesting than housefull 3. what's missing here is ofcourse abhishek bachchan, who has been replaced by our bobby deol, who's the weakest link here..i loved him in his earlier movies though..soldier, barsaat etc!

otherwise, this film by sajid saamji is funny in parts. the cameo appearance by nawazuddin siddiqui is really helping. the songs (especially "ek chumma") are actually entertaining more than the film itself!

since there's no depth in the storyline, you can only expect a little from the actors. akshay, as usual, is funny and on the dot with his comic timing. riteish is good too. while chunky pandey (hilarious) and johnny lever do their part well, the three girls look gorgeous (special mention about pooja hegde) and dance well!

to conclude, i'd recommend this for a time pass or one time watch during your weekend. enjoy guys!

tl;dr: watch this movie only if you like the housefull brand of humour. you'll have a blast.


the film revolves around a bunch of people from 1419 and their reincarnations in 2019. and as the trailer tells you, the three main couples have been mismatched in their reincarnations. "iski biwi iski biwi nahi hai, woh teri biwi hai!" (transl. "his wife isn't his wife, she's your wife!").

if you ask me, the mismatched pairings is maybe the least interesting thing in the movie. the most entertaining thing in this movie is akshay kumar. he is on screen for maybe 90 percent of the time, and that's a good thing. whether his 1419 bala is hilariously scheming for the throne or his 2019 harry is forgetting everything that just happened, i enjoyed every bit of it.

ritiesh did his parts as good as it can get, but he didn't have many parts. i wish we got more of him, like the previous instalments. housefull is an akshay-riteish franchise and it feels like riteish missed out a bit here. speaking of missed-out regulars, boman irani's batuk patel was also dearly missed.

but akshay compensates for almost everything. he does the usual tough bits such as comic timing and dialogue delivery with ease (expected from him at this point), but where he absolutely shines are his facial expressions throughout the movie. whether it is his signature "i don't know", bala's "phish-phish" or (my personal favourite) "bhoola bhoola bhoola bhoola re", he rocks it.

other than akshay, the movie relies on funny character and one-liners. the one-liners work most of the time, but some of them are terribly bad, even by my standards. it also relies on confusion caused by reincarnation and, at times, mocks itself for being a "reincarnation comedy".

as for the rest of the cast: johnny lever unbelievably fails in the first half, but then strikes back towards the end. kriti s, pooja and kriti b do well in the limited roles they have. i wish the leading ladies got better parts instead, like in housefull 1 (and to some extent, hf2). bobby deol tries hard to not be a misfit, but it just doesn't work. ranjeet does well. chunky pandey does well yet again as aakhri pasta. rana daggubati is a surprises with his comedy and he does extremely well. so does the dependable sharad kelkar. nawazuddin enjoys his cameo and makes sure that you do too.

for reasons i can't understand, this movie has received polarising reviews from the audience and critics alike. i know that not everyone is going to like this brand of humour, but it's exactly what you expect from a housefull movie. enjoy the laughter ride!

well, when i checked the reviews for movie, i felt have i done quick pre booking for second day of movie. i was never been so fast in catching up with new movies. overall, if you have watched the housefull series earlier then it has to be a movie that doesnt needs a brain to watch...for 3 hrs you can give break to your brain n keep laughing on all notorious jokes. a perfect movie to watch with frnds n family where you will come out laughing on jokes that are just punched to keep your interest on for three hrs. overall the movie is around bala character and once u r back home u will try the famous step chorerographer has introduced. its not a must watch if you trying to find out something great even after watching the series of housefull movies! i have rated it well, bse i felt it is the movie how it has to be. the bala song itself speaks abt the funny ride you can experience if you plan to watch movie without reading much reviews on it.

first there are funny films that leave an impression for a lifetime (e.g. golmaal of amol palekar, chupke chupke of amitabh & dharmendra, hera pheri, munnabhai mbbs) and then there are those casual weekend watch which makes you laugh your heart out at certain moments during the film but nothing you'll recommend to someone on monday. housefull 4 qualifies for the latter. one great thing about the movie is that it's not a vulgar comedy filled with hindi slangs (which many other directors bank on today to make people laugh). it's old school, clean and meant for a family watch & i really loved it from that stand point. akshay kumar is brilliant. kriti sanon is good too. certain one liners are outright hilarious and will make you laugh. problem is that the support casts (including stalwarts like johnny lever) are absolutely horrible. chunky pandey & bobby deol should stop acting. they are an eye soar. johnny lever's acting as a transgender is difficult to watch and in just how many more movies are they going to make riteish deshmukh behave in a feminine way. there's no originality left in that any longer. the music is terrible & the story is rubbish. however, the best part of the movie are the last 20 mins. so there's a bit to look forward to. therefore, if you're not doing much this weekend, you might like to buy the tickets for this one or not. i'll leave that choice to you 😊

so get this, you are on diwali vacation at home after slaving away and you are together with all your beloved. your sisters are home, your brother who you haven't met for more than a year is also home. you enjoyed diwali to the fullest and after that on a dull day (still few days left of your vacation) you decide for a movie. let me assure you, on that day you are not looking for a mind=blown kind of movie which is a critic pleaser, edge of your seat suspense, thriller etc. you go to housefull 4 and laugh your a$$ off with absolute absurdity and non sense of the highest order. we wanted to enjoy and that's what we did. that's what the purpose of the movie was. 
you will feel intellectually satisfied by bashing this movie right, left and center for all things "wrong", but let me tell you; i don't even remember when was the last time i had tears in my eyes due to laughing so hard, this movie will do that to you if you leave common sense at ticket counter.

‘houseful 4’ should be visited with very low expectations so that you don’t get numbed by the scale of nonsense that goes on for nearly 2 hours 25 minutes.  the relief is that we have seen worse stuff from bollywood.. so this one does not seem to hit the nadir which some others in the past had.
if one is ok with slapstick, mindless comedy (that struggles to evoke scarce laughter), this one may not disappoint.  still not sure if anyone can really stand the scatological jokes the film trundles in great detail!!
akshay kumar tries well- he is the mainstay of the flick.  ladies look sufficiently gorgeous - eye candy quotient is taken care of.
enter this house to see how talented actors can do the buffoonery too with equal elan! 2/5

my rating 

story: 0
screenplay: 0
cgi: 3/5
colour coordination: 4/5
movie overall : 2.5/5

i don’t want to bore you guys with the in-depth detail of the movie. but somethings that are missing is : they probably tried to make a spoof of bahubali also adding one song from bahubali 2 “jay jay kara” but the twisted version. it has scenes from movie “the dictator” and most importantly the popular song bala is a total copy of “bala song by tony montana” 
most of the palace scenes felt just copy paste from bahubali movie. the flashback and rebirth is also from maghadheera telugu movie. the director is great fan of s s rajamouli as he has copied 2 films in one and tried to make it funny. but they fell flat on their faces especially sajid khan who originally wrote the script and idea. 

seems like after bahubali went hit these guys decided to make anything rubbish and feed the people that looks like bahubali. 

the colour coordination and cgi is good but since originality was missing this movie did jot do well. 

looking at the amount of films akshay kumar does its like movies are just money making and numbers for him. he needs to give time to the script rather than just saying yes to anything. 

so i wanted to laugh and tried to laugh but no it did not last long.

movie review: #housefull4

*******spoilers alert warning: certain plot points and themes will be discussed ahead. be-warned***********

the housefull franchise is not needed in this world, but since its out in the universe, lets review it accordingly. before i analyze the movie, lets discuss its parameters first. for a housefull movie, i can not review in the same essence of what i will review a fan, badhaai ho or even bajrangi bhaijaan.

for a housefull movie, i have to limit my parameter to a shelf that 'houses" the race franchise, the aneez bazmee or a farah khan movie.

is the movie gnostistic, homophobic, sexist, misogynistic and derogatory? yes it is in every sense. kirti sanson goes to punch sharad kelkar in one scene, and akshay pulls her aside and mutters "yeh tumhara kaam nahi hai". johnny lever is given the drag makeup and made to believe he is a reincarnation of his daughter. ritiesh deshmukh gives a character sketch and a painful potrayal of a "nartaki".

there are many why's in the movie: why did nawazuddin siddiqui agree to do this horrible role? why does the kabootar's have a better role than bobby deol? why didn't the writer's write a joke in the script?

even askhay kumar decided he gave up on this movie, and for some apparent reason he was in his jogging outfit instead of his wedding sherwani in the climax sequence?

see what i think is that just because we have grown watching such senseless comedies (or bollywood's interpretation of 'comedy'), that its so inbred and ingrained in our brains, that we are compelled to laugh while watching the movie. this is because our brain tells us this is bollywood version of what it thinks is funny, and thats why i should laugh here. this is why i don't blame the average movie goer not understanding my reviews. its like explaining section 377 to ritiesh deshmukh's character in this movie.

this movie was a stretch - i was already complaining by the interval. the songs are... interesting. nothing that pops up. there's is nothing to write about the performances. its there. as for akshay kumar, he did mission mangal, kesari, padman, and then he decided to do housefull 4. choices.

see i'm not stopping you not to see this movie. see it at your own will. but then do switch off your brain, and don't try to look for sense while watching it. you know the standard of bollywood franchise's - don't go in the cinema expecting to watch "the gods must be crazy" or "andaaz apna apna" - it is what it is.

this is just another movie you'll forget about in 2 weeks, toh kyun itna dimaag lagane ka? did you remember welcome back, mubarrakah, or singh is bling? nahi na - toh chill kar!

but i do want you to ask yourself did you laugh at the homophobic, sexist and antagonistic 'jokes' or did you cringe?

ratings: 2 rupees ka pehla director tha, "me-too" didn't enjoy the jokes. 1 star.

the film housefull 4 is a great comedy movie.
the story was nicely drawn from present to past and then again to present.
all the characters played their role at their best.
compared to other films of the housefull franchise this was better than the 3rd movie. it was more hilarious,humorous. 
akshay kumar has done an unexceptionally excellent acting by including all his skills of creating a humour environment in the movie and same for other characters especially chunkey pandey, jhonny lever, ritesh deshmukh, kriti sanon, bobby deol for sure.
my suggestion is to watch this movie as it is a family entertainer, and do watch this movie.
the 2nd part of the movie was better than the 2nd one. so u might find 1st part a bit boring.
thank you.

my rating : 4/5
                            ⭐⭐⭐⭐

this is housefull 4. four! there shouldn't have been even a single one, but there are four of these in the cinematic universe! sigh!

it takes a special kind of talent to write such utter non-sense for a hundred and forty-five minutes. but sajid nadiadwala (producer and story), along with sara bodinar (story and screenplay), tasha bhambra, sparsh khetarpal and sajid khan (he's been credited for screenplay despite everything) have that in abundance. in keeping with the theme of the first three installments - housefull 1, 2 and 3, akshay kumar, riteish deshmukh, bobby deol, kriti sanon, kriti kharbanda and pooja hegde-starrer is just that. a hundred and forty-five minutes of non-sense.

we meet the boys in their present-day avatar in 2019. akshay (harry) is in love with kriti kharbanda (neha), riteish (roy) is in love with pooja hegde (pooja) and bobby (max) is in love with kriti sanon (kriti). that these women are filthy rich, and marrying them would help the men pay off a hefty debt they owe sharad kelkar (michael bhai) is a mere coincidence. they meet their prospective father-in-law, ranjeet (thakral) and after much deliberation, convince him for the rishta.

bala...bala....shaitan ka salla.....go for it this diwali.....funny, loud comedy with high production standards....(07/10)
this is also a tribute, in way to two veteran actors. as many of the younger generation might not know, that chunky pandey and johney lever, were both in tezzaab, 1988, and both are still there after 31 years - indeed an inning well played. and still rocking....

well, for those who have been constantly giving negative reviews for this movie, continuously making that noise on social media with their negative reviews.... 

01
remember what ms balan said in 'dirty picture'? a movie, is only for entertainment. people watch movies, for entertainment. and when it is diwali, it is really immature to hope that people will waste their time thinking if the scenes or story is logical or not. people, want entertainment. and that, is the only thing that matters.

02
comedy, laugh, are of two types. loud and fine. this is loud comedy. one has to understand that. you cannot expect wit in such genre. making people laugh, for two+ hours, is a talent. it requires intelligence. sajid khan, akshay, bobby, johny lever, ritesh, kriti, kirti, pooja.....well, have really worked hard. sajid khan is not stupid....so for those, who are criticizing this movie, please watch more movies...explore.

03
watch hudson hawk, 1991. it was a similar movie. (in terms of stupidity, i mean it is equal. it had such funny sand stupid story and scenes.... )there are many others, but i am quoting this one just for example. bruce willis did this, when he was sitting on the top of the world. there, the same critics will appreciate it...but this one, they will not. sad. if you like a fun, absurd movie of hollywood, why not this? it is this cocoon type mentality of indians, who cannot see any good in india....well, contrary to whatever the critics think, this is one movie which will give you full paisa vasool entertainment for diwali...

directors and team, have worked hard to maintain high standards of production, and no where you will see a sign of low production values.....people realize this and appreciate. sajid nadiadwala and director have matured over the time, worked hard, and have finally deliver a movie that everyone will like. a movie for mass....

akshay leads. and he does it well. his song, bala...bala.....has good music, tilting music and i would remember this for a long time. i guarantee, for next years, in all parties and dj, this one will remain a favorite.
bobby, johny lever, ritesh, kriti, kirti, pooja, chunky....well the list is endless. all three girls, are caste appropriately, and they spread their share of glamour and navels. johny lever's daughter is surprise. well at least for me. full marks for both father daughter duo. bobby as dharamputra and ritesh as bangdu are also good. no complaints. rana daggubatti is funny and has a bright future in comedy. loud, of course. ranjeet, parikshit sahani register their presence.

in nutshell, people spending crores on movies, are not stupid. they are in fact wise. i recommend this movie, for loud comedy, high production values and a shaitan ka salla....go for it.

the story was nicely drawn from present to past and then again to present.
all the characters played their role at their best.
compared to other films of the housefull franchise this was better than the 3rd movie. it was more hilarious,humorous. 
akshay kumar has done an unexceptionally excellent acting by including all his skills of creating a humour environment in the movie and same for other characters especially chunkey pandey, jhonny lever, ritesh deshmukh, kriti sanon, bobby deol for sure.
my suggestion is to watch this movie as it is a family entertainer, and do watch this movie.
the 2nd part of the movie was better than the 2nd one. so u might find 1st part a bit boring.

one of the worst disastrous movie which i hv seen terrible acting, bad writing, no strory, and without a single comedy scene  which actually make u laugh. it looks like watching any b grade movie with a list actors. 
this film will surely make u feel why r u here?  
kriti sanon dilouge 'yeh ho kya raha hai?' (which is repeated many times in the movie)was heart touching😂   because it was the feeling internally.😑
ending is good 😁 people ran towards to the door of the thetre as two hour torture came end. 😆
rating 1 out of ten (only for the actors atleast they give their best)

let me do you a favor by telling u dat don’t watch this movie because the movie is all a forceful comedy. 😝  😷 this is a movie which is injurious to your health.      you get to realize that u made a mistake coming to the movie in first 10 minutes 🕑 but u are in now. 🙊 you think that it can't get bad than this, but u are wrong, it gets worst. 😂😭 the only slight ray of light in darkness 💡is #akshaykumar's homour which makes u sit for the entire length of movie. 💺best is the ‘bala’ song 🎵 with nice choreography.    💃   the 1st two housefull movies were good, 👌  even housefull 3 was grt, 👏 but this one is complete trash.  🚽   talent of #johnylever, #nawazuddin & #ranadaggubati got wasted. 👎  too much of experience spoil the taste of the food.      something similar happened here.     ‍♀ a warm message to all the directors...." when keeping a mass of starcast, handle with care"   🎥    🍹🎶🎵 rating: 2/5

reincarnation drags the leads from london to a fort in sitamgarh,india for marriage. here starts the twist as characters are reversed and lovers swapped. housefull 4 could have been better scripted. inspite of that the actors have pulled it off quite well. reincarnation comedy should not be tried again. 

glamour rules the scene everytime the female leads come on screen. songs are good but too many. akshay' pupils rotation frequency and hearing a loud noise to forget things was forceful comedy and could have been reduced.
a. the movie depends a lot on akshay kumar
b. bobby deol's come back is impressive
c. ritesh deshmukh manages to sustain
d. yesteryear ranjit papaji is too good
e. jonny lever could have been used better
f. rana daggubati does a fab job
g. nawaz's entry was of no use
h. chunky pandey's character is catchy

akshay kumar emerges as the most entertaining actor in the film. his bala act is superb but even in the 2019 portions, he is too good. riteish deshmukh comes next. as the effeminate bangdu maharaj, he does a fine job which was expected as he has done similar roles in the past. bobby deol is disappointing as he doesn’t have much to contribute in terms of humour. rana daggubati is excellent in both avatars. he adds to the fun in the pre-climax and climax especially. talking of the girls, all three look stunning. kriti sanon gets her share of interesting scenes. kriti kharbanda makes a mark in the scenes where she hums hindi songs. pooja hegde is decent. chunky panday doesn't get enough scope as in part 1 and 2 but he gets to be a part of some crazy scenes. johny lever manages some laughs in the second half. sharad kelkar is efficient in a small role. manoj pahwa raises laughs in his cameo appearance. ranjeet is fine. jamie lever is okay and the johny lever connection comes at a surprise. parikshit sahni is nothing great. nawazuddin siddiqui is awkward.
songs are average and they won’t have a recall value. 'shaitan ka saala' is the best of the lot. 'ek chumma' comes next followed by 'badla'. 'the bhoot song' is the weakest part of the film while 'chammo' is forgettable. julius packiam's background score is theatrical and the recurring theme is catchy.
sudeep chatterjee's cinematography adds to the grandeur. sham kaushal's action is good. amit ray and subrata chakraborty's production design is splendid. costumes compliment the characters. the ladies especially look gorgeous in both avatars. do it creative, ai solve ltd and prime focus's vfx is of superior quality. the sitamgarh kingdom especially is depicted in a fascinating manner. rameshwar s bhagat's editing is inconsistent and there are several jumps in the narrative.

on the whole, housefull 4 is a major disappointment and suffers on the account of poor writing and vacuous screenplay. the negative word of mouth will ensure that it will crash at the box office though it might still end up crawling to rs. 100 crore mark on account of festive period and the extended weekend.

i'll give it 1 star out of 5 😧😧😧😖😱

it's a great family movie to watch, no vulgar language comedy like most of the movies now a days. tagging along the housefull series this part 4 is better than the other 3 not over top of unessary dialogues or comedy. balanced out perfectly however some scenes could have been improved or highlighted more for example in the 1419 story line, what happened to the king after everyone died or how the villan die in that part of story (1419) ?
overall good entertainment and a must watch if you love comedy or akshay!

i personally do not like this franchise but had to go for the film for my 3 virgo girls and the way they all laughed their guts out was good enough. and it was not only my family but umpteen other folks who were laughing their gut out.

this film needs to be watched with your brain left at home and not wanting to find logic in the proceedings. if you can do that and you are a fan of slapstick comedy you ought to go for it. it would also help if you are able to recollect some past songs as there are multiple recalls to these in the movies with some one liners.

i am going with 3 stars 3 for the way my family laughed and enjoyed the movie.

my rating :3/5

mujhe film pasand aai. new concept laye 
hai akshay comedy ka. story aachi hai
, acting :akshay best hai every acting me retesh also best, bobby is ok, all 3girls are okk. best  jonny lever given laughing whenever he come on screen. 1 half good but 2half, hilarious comedy evry scenes best part of the film is it claimax. total film was good. u should to watch it with friends and family. happy diwali to all💥💥💥

this movie was amazing! i really enjoyed and watched with my family. if you are going for a hilarious film only then i wouldn't recommend. it is more action- packed and filled with drama with a strong storyline and has mild humor. but it will make you laugh when there is humor. it is a full family entertainer and in my opinion the best housefull. every actor did their roles well. bobby deol finally did a great movie in a long time. riteish desmukh's bangdu maharaj character was hilarious and bala was iconic too. i urge everyone to watch this film. enjoy! 😂

i don't know why most of the audience is criticizing the film. housefull franchise was always a no brainier watch. housefull 1 was hilarious, 2nd was just okay, i did not even dare to watch the 3rd.

but 4th was between 1st and 2nd. a story based on reincarnation (like ek paheli leela), with some pjs making up for the comedy (as the franchise always had been). even though they hopelessly copied bala from the dictator, if you have watched it and leave the anger behind, you will enjoy this in nostalgia. if you keep an adamant mindset and watch this movie, you are not going to enjoy it. but if you watch it how the director wants you to watch it, you are definitely gonna enjoy it.

i agree that they could have put more effort in the screenplay which is the main reason i am giving this movie a 3.5 star rating.

bad it does not keep up like the 1st and 2nd one. bad jokes farad samji is trying to copy the same jokes nothing new . he even messed up with the web series boo and copied all his old movie dialogue from all the best , and entertainment he should have new stuff. sajid as producer show try new raw talent not seen it would have been better specially in writing or get inspired by the dream girl movie and learn from it sorry to say. akshay please have more creative people with new comedy writers ideas in your menu. i love your movie de dhana dhan you can watch upteen times and not get bored this was a waste. even your part 1 and 2 was so good then 3 was down and this one is out of the windows.
i think annes baazi would have done a better job like he did for you in welcome
all the actors and actress are good but the content sucks not up to the mark. what a waste of talents

one sensible guy can easily predict what words are coming next.... “aaj mera fast hai  isliye main tujhe slow mar raha hu...”
even without logic some movies make us laugh... but this movie is a pure torture.... pure pure torture....for me atleast.... people have different taste... two guys sitting beside me were enjoying and  laughing so hard that they made us laugh way more than houseful 4 did... 
i rarely tend to write a review of a movie but now u can feel that the temptation to write about the movie  is irresistible...
by the way story writers produce what people demand.... ultimately they want to earn money... and houseful 4 succeeds....

i have just watched the movie and would like to tell everyone please and please do not go by the reviews of these so called critics of times of india and bollywoodhungama. they lost the main concept of the movie that it is a comedy. they wanted logic which is stupid. 

now the honest review : nobody in bollywood would have dared to make a spoof or comedy on reincarnation - this is a total different concept. plus the comedy - loved the movie and specially akshay. this movie deserves just love not incorrect criticism.  it’s a paisa vasool movie. i give them 4 star and may be 4.5/5 - the actresses were good too. 
have fun guys and watch the movie - the movie is reel life not real life so don’t look or search for logic.

i just watched the movie today. it is one of the best comedy movie of the decade. the audience went crazy in the hall. they were all whistling and enjoying the movie.
akshay is the masterpiece. along with him, other actors have also contributed very well. it will remind you the madness of "phir hera pheri". 
moreover, the visuals, sound design and songs are superb! 


verdict: 
4/5

just one thing, please don't find logic in the movie while watching it. it is for fun and not to improve your analytical reasoning exam. if you really want to improve analytical skills, please go and bring arun sharma's cat books.

laughing riot😂🔥& one more reason why akshay can't be replaced when it comes to comedy.
"comedy is subjective" & each one of us take jokes are different way n manner,some you had a lol moment even on dumb joke,some you will no laugh even on good one,so as housefull4 is no brainer but laughing riot all the way,& akshay kumar as bala just nailed it,he can just bring smile on your face out of nowhere & ritiesh deshmukh is as always top notch.all in all complete family entertainer🌟🌟🌟🌟/5.this one is diwali treat.💥

absolutely pathetic. i do not understand how such movies are allowed to be made. 

there is extreme racism in this movie. while i understand that india does not have the best relationship with britain, this movie takes this to another level. in the song 'ek chumma' there are several british flags in the back, actors are made to look like prince charles, prince harry and william, and kate and meghan, and they are all dancing along. furthermore, akshay kisses a queen elizabeth lookalike. how distasteful. 

firstly, the movie reinforces stereotypical gender roles. such movies are one of the causes for sexism in india. while the 3 men were holding their swords bravely, the women are seen playing with bangles. the men in the movie attempt to please the women by placing her in danger and then 'saving her.' while kriti measures bobby's biceps, he measures her waist and says 'wow what a waist one inch thinner," thus reinforcing beauty standards, leading to body image issues. ridiculous. while akshay kumar does fantastic movies, i cannot believe he agreed to doing such a shameful movie. 

other than these core issues, the movie is absolutely pathetic. the plot is horrible, and the lines are also. johnny lever wearing a sari, and ritesh acting 'feminine' is just not funny. the houseful series becomes worse each time. this time we had to leave the theatre halfway. the age difference between the men and the women was also disgusting. 

while fantastic movies are made in the bollywood industry, such movies are an embarrassment to the industry.

i definitely enjoyed the 2 hours...it was so entertaining throughout...the hilarious part was when everyone remembered their past life except of kriti s...the expression akshay sir gave was hilarious..but it also follows the happy ending that is taken up by most of the movies...riteish sir had done a great job in this movie as bangdu maharaj...the addition of dharamputra was a cherry on top of the cake...in short i am head over heels in love with this movie...one last funny thing is akshay sir's eyes when he forget what happened in the past one minute by hearing loud sounds...if you haven't seen it yet...what are you waiting for go on to watch this amazing movie...

in the end,

hail rajkumar bala dev singh..

critics don't like comedy. this film is not for critics. its for the normal people to enjoy. these biased critics would die laughing at silly racist jokes of russell peters but they would trash such movies. if you like silly comedies in akshay style you will love this one as well.. especially the second half is very funny. i got my total paisa vasool..hope people make more comedy films like this. it's becoming a rarity today. 

3.5/5 stars from me.. watch it in theatres to enjoy it with your family.

i think after housefull 1.... housefull 4 was the second best by the franchise. felt a bit fast and end could have been epic but guyz....it's housefull seriese you are talking about. and this edition was kind of hatke from the same bs happening in hf 2 and 3.

for a new concept and really good graphics , a 5/10  from me.  

edits:
 and as per all housefull endings..... billionaire heroins didn't came across the truth that the heros were marring them for money. now that was definitely different 😂.

housefull 4 - yet another disasterpiece by sajid nadiadwala but this one is seriously waahiyaatwala. 
but it ain't that much weird bcoz it keeps u occupied, for the first half u will find yourself struggling to figure out its genre  and for the entire second half u can laugh at yourself to make such a choice and at your tragic helplessness to bear it for almost 2:30 hour. 
you can't afford to watch it unless u are a die hard akshay fan(always a treat to eye) or u haven't got diwali bonus. 
and l wish if the censor board could change the franchise's name from "housefull" to "awful" . it can save a lot of time and money man.

don't go with the hype that it is not a good film. its a pure entertainer. from start to end. yes, few things will seem inlogical. but c'mon man its a entertainment package. 
they didnt told that dey are potraying a real life scenario and one thing u can bet on is the acting of akshay kumar and jhony lever was bangon. his expression will burst u in laughter and punches are delivered very well. 

i m sure if you are looking for entertaintment you will not be dissapointed.

:)

i loved this movie. the comedic timing of ritiesh and akshay is gold, and it is a pleasure to watch the 2 perform. the actresses have also done a stunning job, nailing the emotional roles and showing their comedy as well. i believe that after housefull 1, housefull 4 ranks at 2 because of the comedy and the overall plot and lovingness if the movie. a absolute great movie for families and kids. please go watch it as soon as you can.

we really loved the film.... akki again proved that he is a very very versatile actor who shines not only in action films but also comedy dramas. the trio of heroines also did a fantastic job, supported by riteish and bobby... a must watch film if u wanna laugh heartily. 😃😁

i am astonished by the irredeemable ignorance of a bunch of talented actors indulged in creating a ridiculously underwhelming movie ; housefull 4. director farhad samji who also co-directed housefull 3, is time travelling here through 600 years. and it is undoubtedly a tedious journey for the audience. the movie is tightly packed with actors like akshay kumar, bobdy deol, ritesh desmukh, rana daggubati , sharad kelkar and nawazuddin siddiqui....the list can be longer if i count the rest. the women in the movie are just as same as the jokes in the movie, shallow, fatuous and unendurable. and it runs for 145 minutes , you want anything more ? since there is no plot, nothing to talk about it and about the performances, i don't even wanna remember that. it's the shortest review i have ever written i guess..for the dumbest movie i saw this year. i'm going with zero stars. 0️⃣.

literally awesome (for kids who love illogical comedy)!
i looovveed the movie truly! 
stupidly funny and punny, the story revolves around how they seek their true loves from their last birth... this movie is strictly not for the people who can't close their mind and want to find logic in everything.. if you are going to watch this, put your brains in the trash can and if u do that, u are 100% going to enjoy it! kids will love it!

you go in for a comedy expecting laughs. but i came out of this one giving away barely a chuckle.

johnny lever's present-day character, as an english-speaking hotel manager,  was bright and amusing, until it kicked in to the reincarnation avatar. all downhill after that baby!

deshmukh and bobby were wasted, with unimpressive characters and uninspiring performances. they were also not helped by the writing and seriously offered little relevance to proceedings. 

akshay tries the most to be funny, and it almost works. his medieval character could have been a blast, but is a victim to atrocious writing, jokes and screenplay. the hairdresser character is uneven and silly. 

the three heroines were reduced to dancing and smiling at each other in awe of what they feel is a great impression created by the one or all of the three heroes. kriti sanon is half decent, the rest were just bad! 

chunky was just loud and repetitive. too much of anything is bad, even pasta, with or without sauce!  

the songs came in thick and thin to annoy at the oddest times. rana, as gamma, showed early promise, only to fizzle out in relevance towards the climax-from intimidating to silly by the time the credits roll.

at the end of the day, the low caliber writing and screenplay really beats the audience to pulp. i sincerely hoped to be entertained. i resisted from walking out only because i generally love akshay's work; at least most of the times. 

prayer to the director- if one really has to make garbage, one ought to also make sure there is segregation at source. this ones all mixed, wet, and left to carry a solid stench! 

it may make money and what people like me feel don't matter. but if there is a housefull 5 ever, it surely won't see me bother. i wish i had learnt  my lesson with housefull 3!

housefull 4 is probably the best movie i have seen in the last 1 year. akshay kumar, ritesh deshmukh and bobby deol gives their best in the movie and aakhri pasta (chunky pandey) adds some more magic in the movie. johnny lever also gives the best to the movie. the saddest thing is that they have not give credit to sajid khan, the original director of the movie. they have given credit to farhad samji. the 1st half shows that the movie is a sajid khan comedy. the 2nd half is full of reshoots done by farhad samji and many good scenes are removed like the famous scene meri biwi meri biwi nahi hai and many other are removed. 1st half was awesome and 2nd half was good. actress have also  done good including kriti sanon and other actress. if the 2nd half was awesome then the movie would have been more fun. my rating is 7/10. just go and watch the movie.

this movie is literally the reason why people hate bollywood. slapstick humour, old and worn out plot, the same old story, references from absolutely nowhere, and no actually storyline. if you watched this on diwali, i fell sad for the time lost with your family members watching this abomination. and to the people complaining that why people don't support indian movies, why this double-faced nature towards bollywood, let me explain that bollywood is more than nepotism and franchise-milking. nawazuddin siddiqui was in this movie too, and his work in sacred games is a fact that bollywood is not this. if bollywood is all about sexism, misogyny, and double meaning 'jokes', you can take your bollywood elsewhere. there were so many good releases this year, but this movie wasn't one of them. skip it please, if you like your sanity. also fyi, this movie just builds upon jokes from previous housefull movies, so yes, you have to watch them all to get the 'humour'. amazon prime doesn't sound bad now, does it??

a best film to watch with family and friends , i don't know wanna say it in detail but it has mind blowing comedy and the twists were awesome . it's a good movie for those who love the historical settings.  i don't know y imdb gave that worse rating. but it is very good film to entertain anyone.
overall my rating is 9.5 / 10

if you are bored at home and want to laugh your hearts out, you can certainly catch this latest instalment of housefull which is entertaining and funny. after reading all the negative reviews even i was a bit skeptic about watching it but it turned out to be a nice and time pass movie and thats what is the primary reason for watching movie passing time with your loved ones or family. isn't it.. go for it and its definitely not as bad as its made out to be.

i don't know why people are hating it. the movie is quite awesome. i would recommend you guys to watch it. like akshay kumar's acting as bala was outstanding. reincarnation comedy is a new thing touched by bollywood. we should appreciate it. the movie should get 6 or 7 stars at least. it has the humour that we require. it's full of humour from the beginning till the end. perfect movie for me. housefull franchise has always been close to my heart

an average movie.
but it will make you laugh and that's what is expected out of it.
i don't think people have to search logic in such movies. they are made just to give you a good laugh and it is doing it's work to some extent.
akshay kumar as always had given his best and will make you laugh as bala and harry. 
nothing else was there to watch on diwali  and many theatres are having too many shows. 
not waste of money at least and not must watch also. go for it if you are bored and want to have a laugh.

not that i thought housefull 4 to be a serious film on india‑china relationship, but never expected it to be this ...

amazing movie #mast hai. must watch for every one(go and watch). this movie is a perfect mixture of *comedy+...

it’s a full on entertainer for diwali. it will make you laugh and keep you entertained from start till the credits start to roll. ...

mitwa kumar
posting publicly.

i loved this movie !!! it’s nonsensical and so much fun ... the entire hall was laughing through our. be it akshay kumar’s eyes doing a keshto mukherjee or deshmukhs hilarious gender confused verbal output ,to everyone’s reincarnation or gama marega 😂 and the use of alia bhatt , mahesh bhatt . all the stars were great and i think 100percent fun . just don’t go looking for logic and you will love it.

well for starters. i did not enjoy this one as much as i did the earlier films in the housefull series.
to me it felt as if not enough humor and the existing jokes were the same typical ones that are repeated again and again. maybe i had my anticipations too high after hfull 1,2 & 3, which all seemed genuinely original and full of fun especially the 3 installment. akshay like always is the one who delivers the best and unforgettable laughs. i would give this movie a mediocre rating of 2.5/5.

well, if u have watched 1st three installments of housefull, u must know that u need to rest ur brain and never try to find logic in housefull franchise movies. this part has little humour. the movie is watchable only because of akshay sir's comic timing and few punches from the great comedian johny lever sir. the climax is very similiar to part 2 where jagga daaku was chasing the gang.
in the end, if u just want to kill time and enjoy some slapstick comedy, go watch housefull 4. otherwise, u should skip. my rating 3/5 (1 extra for akshay sir).

it was a superb film. look, logic and comedy both are hard to be found together. if you like logical films, then this is definitely not for you. but if you can keep away logic, you will definitely enjoy this movie a lot. it was very hilarious
compared to other movies of housefull series, it was slightly below expectation, but it has a lots and lots of bundles of comedy.
its a must watch film.
#must watch.

this is an amazing movie. each scene is packed with powerful punches that will surely make you laugh. there some lines that make you go "ehh..." but the rest of the movie covers them up. the story is unique and interesting, the acting is nice and especially the ending, was satisfactory. the movie ties itself together seemlessly and is a must-watch. 
in short, go watch it. you won't regret spending your money.

keep ur mind aside and watch this entertaining reincarnation comedy. i have not seen anyone leaving his seat. post interval quite entertaining. critics seems to be harsh. if u want comedy then it shud be senseless yet entertaining. akshay kumar is king of such comedy. johnny lever proves that old is gold. cinematography is superb."bala" song is good and the qawaali by rana dagubatti is a surprise.  a cameo by nawazuddin siddiqui adds extra smile.

i don't understand for what reason people are not finding the movie funny. the theatre i was in everyone was on their seats laughing. there is a scene where there was a literal thunder of laughter in the entire theatre. the people finding logic, c'mon dude its a comedy movie what do you expect interstellar?
if you wanna have fun, lighten up your mood and have cramps while laughing (if you understand humor) then it's a must go.

i liked the the whole housefull franchise.. and recently the 4th chapter of it..  the housefull 4..
   it's so comedy movie.. it made me laugh  a lot.. i love all the akshay kumar films..  bcauz his all the movies are fantastic and amazing... 
  this is family movie.. every one can watch it..  but only leaving 2-3 all the remaining movie much better by the all movies that pretents us to laugh.. 
   this movie cast akshay kumar, ritesh deshmukh, bobby deol, kriti sanon, kriti kharbanda, and pooja hedge as in the lead rolls...

house full 4 is a must watch family entertainer which will add joy to your diwali mood. there is hardly any dull moment in the film which is full of laughter. 
great perferormence by akshay kumar again. rest of the cast did their best in keep you entertained till the end.
please don't go by the negative comments by the critics and all go and enjoy the movie with your family.

housefull 4 2019 new bollywood comedy movie, a revenge story that forces all the characters to take birth again after 600 years.

akshay kumar(bala), ritesh deshmukh, bobby deol,  kirti sanoon, kiriti kharbanda, pooja hegde and all the associated characters 

have reborn in the film.

this video is a detailed review of the film. movie starts with historic places and continues till the interval. akshay kumar who is london ghajni in charector plays his part very well.

the climax is good, but the film fails to impress as previous housefull films did. you would love to see the film in second half where all the roles are in present and plays well

3/5 stars to the movie

this movie was very much illogical. too many elements were being added which made the scenes very boring and idiotic. but there are also certain bits in this film which are hilarious. if a person who watches a lot of hollywood movies and if they go and watch this film they will get to know that a lot of scenes or plots were inspired or copied from certain iconic hollywood movies. i think till now none of the houseful releases could beat the first houseful movie where lara dutta and deepika padukone were the main actresses. rating- 3/5.

1/5
it is said that the morning shows the day. likewise, from the trailer we can often judge a movie. 

i had expected a crass movie full of stupid jokes and i watched one. its hard to believe that someone other than sajid khan can direct such a bad movie. 

it's not that everything is bad. mr akshay kumar tried his best to uplift the movie. the other actors were also not bad. but the script and direction were so very bad that the movie turned out to be a disaster. i really feel sad for johnny lever and nawazuddin siddiqui for abusing their talents. 

this movie is for kapil sharma fans. others might watch it at their own risk. i personally watched the movie in a theater to watch the reaction of other audiences and trust me, i was not disappointed.

p.s. for all the reviewers marking this as a family movie, i do not know what kind of family equations they have. i personally can never even tell my parents that i have watched such a classless and sexist movie.

movie reviews are always personal opinion. so, anyone getting influenced by these opinion you're loosing your chance.
overall this movie is amazing and perfect diwali gift for all the people who loves entertainment and fun.
perfect package to watch with your family and kids.
and yes happy diwali everyone have a housefull diwali. 
ignore the negative reviews. 
go ahead you'll have blast in this movie. ❤

guys don't go on critics review they only want to spread negativity on the film which is story less.. as we know the housefull series made for the purpose of laugh and entertainment .. there is no story bt lots of happiness is there...and h4 gives us same feeling. akshay kumar is on fire as bala or harry....every single scene u will laugh ..others done awsm work..so go n live it...4*/5...must watch

writing off a film is easy. but if you can appreciate the effort that has gone to design the sets, costumes and getting the look right not forgetting the research that must have gone behind it ...you 'll realise the grand scale of this film. a stellar star cast and ace comedians in place makes you glued to the seat. the franchise holds lots of promise ahead too this film ensures.

i don’t normally write these movie reviews but for this movie i just had to. i have watched housefull 1, 2 and 3 and they were all amazing but this movie just sucked👎 i had walked in with expectations of it being at least a funny movie but it was just filled up with cheesy jokes and the same rhyming sequence that annoyed a string in my head. i thought the movie would eventually get good but it did not... bobby deol in the housefull series is just not a good fit. many people have liked this movie, which i fail to see why? if you are easily satisfied by cringey jokes then this is for you. i just watched a random episode of friends and believe you me it was way better than the entire movie!
waste of time

its a brilliant entertainer. the critics have no sense of humor for the illogical but hilarious masterpiece. yeah its not logical, but its comedy and not maths. you want logic go solve some equations. it has everyone rolling around their seats through and through. every scene thrills and fills you with cachinnating laughter.

a good one entertainer,,one time watchable could have been more better but still its an amazing movie...many funny scenes,,will surely make u laugh talking about cast akshay kumar as always supperb ritesh deshmukh too stole the show,bobby average girls all 3 did perfect chunky pandey also supperb.... background music n songs too were amazing,,overall a good movie go for it
my rating:- 3.8/5
